item.title: Comment on A New Kind of Resolution by martha
item.dc:creator: martha
item.description:
Tom, thanks for the pointer, will check it out. Sounds like either way I win.
However I must admit that I'm equally excited about the fact that your comment means that my ever-flowing wisdom is not blocked by the Chinese government & therefore readable there. You're welcome, China!
item.content:encoded:
Tom, thanks for the pointer, will check it out. Sounds like either way I win.

However I must admit that I’m equally excited about the fact that your comment means that my ever-flowing wisdom is not blocked by the Chinese government & therefore readable there. You’re welcome, China!

item.title: Comment on A New Kind of Resolution by Tom
item.dc:creator: Tom
item.description:
For meditation, someone recommended to me a book called "Real Happiness." He then mentioned you can skip the book and download the audio files and it's just as good ( http://www.workman.com/static/realhappinessebook/ ). If you feel bad about downloading the audio files and not paying, you can probably try to meditate away the stress. If it works you're all set, and if it doesn't work, then you can be glad you didn't pay for them.
I tried listening to the first one and I fell asleep. I'm not sure if that means it worked or it didn't.
item.content:encoded:
For meditation, someone recommended to me a book called “Real Happiness.” He then mentioned you can skip the book and download the audio files and it’s just as good ( http://www.workman.com/static/realhappinessebook/ ). If you feel bad about downloading the audio files and not paying, you can probably try to meditate away the stress. If it works you’re all set, and if it doesn’t work, then you can be glad you didn’t pay for them.

I tried listening to the first one and I fell asleep. I’m not sure if that means it worked or it didn’t.

item.title: Comment on Forward March by martha
item.dc:creator: martha
item.description: Ha, thanks Des. Man, after re-reading that blog post there are a lot of things I would do differently if I knew what I know now when I wrote that! I guess hindsight is 20:20. But thanks, I did mean it and focusing, regardless of anything else, was the right thing to do to get where things are today.
item.content:encoded: Ha, thanks Des. Man, after re-reading that blog post there are a lot of things I would do differently if I knew what I know now when I wrote that! I guess hindsight is 20:20. But thanks, I did mean it and focusing, regardless of anything else, was the right thing to do to get where things are today.

item.title: Comment on Forward March by Des Traynor
item.dc:creator: Des Traynor
item.description:
There's something great about a very old post from you (in 2012) talking about focus you would now have: http://martharotter.com/blog/index.php/2012/09/the-price-of-focus/
Shows you really meant it.
item.content:encoded:
There’s something great about a very old post from you (in 2012) talking about focus you would now have: http://martharotter.com/blog/index.php/2012/09/the-price-of-focus/

Shows you really meant it.

item.title: Comment on The price of focus by Jeannette
item.dc:creator: Jeannette
item.description: Congratulations on your place in Wayra! I know what you mean about the trouble of context switching, but it sounds like you had a good schedule and handled it well! I am glad that we were able to take on some of your load with IGGD, and hope that you will now have more time to attend! All the best!
item.content:encoded: Congratulations on your place in Wayra! I know what you mean about the trouble of context switching, but it sounds like you had a good schedule and handled it well! I am glad that we were able to take on some of your load with IGGD, and hope that you will now have more time to attend! All the best!

item.title: Comment on What’s The Big Idea? by Edward Savage
item.dc:creator: Edward Savage
item.description:
Hi Martha,
Really like your stuff. Perhaps you could give me a shout. I have a personal interest in ideas and a professional interest in digital publishing.
Best Ed
item.content:encoded:
Hi Martha,

Really like your stuff.
Perhaps you could give me a shout. I have a personal interest in ideas and a professional interest in digital publishing.

Best
Ed

item.title: Comment on Daily Lessons from 2011 by Tikitakatechy
item.dc:creator: Tikitakatechy
item.description:
Hey Martha.
What a fantastic idea.
I definitely suffer from poor recall of everything from major project i have worked on to what i had for breakfast yesterday. I'll start a daily list myself, see if it can jog my memory.
item.content:encoded:
Hey Martha.

What a fantastic idea.

I definitely suffer from poor recall of everything from major project i have worked on to what i had for breakfast yesterday. I’ll start a daily list myself, see if it can jog my memory.
